action.action-desc: Mr. Reichert (for himself and Mr. Walz of Minnesota) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the annual report required on veterans’ reemployment rights.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improving Veterans' Reemployment Act of 2007.

subsection.text: Section 4332 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The Secretary shall and inserting (a) Report required.—The Secretary shall;
by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (6) as paragraphs (5) through (7), respectively, and inserting after paragraph (3) the following new paragraph (4):

The number of cases reviewed by the Secretary of Defense under the National Committee for Employer Support of the Guard and Reserve of the Department of Defense during the fiscal year for which the report is made.
by redesignating paragraph (7), as so redesignated, as paragraph (8), and inserting after paragraph (6) the following new paragraph (7):
An indication of which of the cases reported on pursuant to paragraphs (1), (2), (3), and (4) are disability-related.
by adding at the end the following new subsections:

subsection.text: The Secretary shall coordinate with the Secretary of Defense, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, the Attorney General, and the Special Counsel to ensure that the information required to be submitted as part of the report under subsection (a) is categorized in a uniform way.

The Secretary shall provide the information contained in the report required under subsection (a) to the Secretary of Defense, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, the Attorney General, and the Special Counsel.
The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to a report submitted after the date of the enactment of this Act.
